name: St. Epaphras

locations.description: Founder of churches in Colossae, Hierapolis, and Laodicea

summary: Epaphras was a companion of Paul the Apostle and the founder of the Christian churches in Colossae, Hierapolis, and Laodicea. Paul describes him as a 'faithful minister of Christ' and 'a servant of Christ Jesus' who worked hard for the Colossians, Laodiceans, and Hierapolitans. He was imprisoned with Paul in Rome and is mentioned in the Epistle to the Colossians. According to tradition, he became the first bishop of Colossae and was martyred there.
